articles.title: North America's oldest dinosaur is completely rewriting history - Earth.com
articles.description: Researchers discovered Ahvaytum bahndooiveche fossils in Wyoming, revealing dinosaurs in Laurasia earlier than believed.
articles.content:
Have you ever wondered how and when the fascinating era of dinosaurs began? For decades, paleontologists have been debating this question, armed mostly with fragmented fossil records and theories.

articles.author: Stephanie Pappas
articles.title: Scientists find hidden 'hotspot' that helped create the Great Lakes before North America even existed - Livescience.com
articles.description: A hotspot that now lies in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean was once under the Great Lakes, and may explain why they formed where they did.
articles.content:
The Great Lakes formed where they did 20,000 years ago thanks to a hotspot that sat under the supercontinent Pangaea 300 million years ago, before North America even existed.
